body: We're seeing exactly the same issue here https://github.com/wavebox/waveboxapp/issues/284

I've just added a super simple example into git demonstrating the bug...

```
git clone https://github.com/wavebox/electron-quick-start.git
cd electron-quick-start
git checkout singleinstance-bug
npm install
npm start
```
Then in a new terminal....
```
npm start
```
@Thomas101 Thanks a lot for helping out with a simple example.

issue.title: Can't invoke Caret more than once, the last instance will wait for the other one to finish
issue.body:
I was wanting to open a bunch of files directly from Nautilus and double-clicked a file to open it.

Once it opened i did the same for another one, but the new Caret process just looked like it was hung, but after one minute the old file got closed, while the new one opened instead.

The same thing can be achieved, instead of waiting, by closing the first editor instance: then the new one will open instantly.

As a workaround i can create a new window and drag-and-drop the file from Nautilus.

issue.title: makeSingleInstance does not work on 1.7.4

repository.name: electron
repository.description: :electron: Build cross-platform desktop apps with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS

issue.body:
We have an app that uses makeSingleInstance.

When upgrading to electron 1.7.4, when running a second instance of the app, it would hang for a while, and then kill the first instance and start the new instance.
The expected behavior is that the first instance would move to the front while the second instance would quit.

This was observed on both OSX and Ubuntu 16.04.

Tested on electron 1.6.11 and it works fine.

Thanks

issue.title: Part 1 of fix for #484 - fix issue where Oni won't open from dock

repository.name: oni
repository.description: Oni: Modern Modal Editing - powered by Neovim

issue.body:
This fixes a couple of issues opening Oni on OSX:
1) Oni won't open from dock - this was due to an incorrect call to `createWindow` without the full set of supplied parameters
2) Oni won't open from terminal, if there is an instance already open. This is an issue with Electron 1.7.4, specifically electron/electron#9880 and electron/electron#9965

issue.title: Can't Open Multiple instances via Typora.desktop and /bin/typora (Ubuntu 16.04.3 Xenial)

repository.name: typora-issues
repository.description: Bugs, suggestions or free discussions about the minimal markdown editor  Typora

issue.body:
v0.9.32 (beta) Aug 13
**Issue:**
Unable to open **2nd instance** via 1) **GUI** (file browser) or 2)**CLI** (/bin/typora) to open a blank or an existing file.

**Not an issue:** 
I'm able to open 2nd instance through Typora's **file > new file** or **file > open recent**. **No problems** there, thankfully.

**My System:**
I've used Lubuntu and Xubuntu 16.04.3 Xenial. Both of them have the same issue

**BONUS**
THANK YOU FOR MAKING TYPORA :+1:  (Sorry, I figure this is a thankless job lol.). I love using this for school notes! Keep up the good work!!!

body: I am seeing the same thing in macOS. Is there a separate issue tracking that or do the labels and title of this just need updating?

@mattridley we're not seeing it with macOS or Windows only linux. Which version of electron did you see it with? Do you see the problem if you try it with the electron-quick-start above? https://github.com/electron/electron/issues/9880#issuecomment-311649579
I saw it with 1.7.5 (reverting back to 1.6.11 fixes the issue). I also have the problem with the quick start (see https://youtu.be/CNFhWWF77Ms)

issue.body: - [ ] Verify OSX regression is fixed (or find workaround)

issue.title: Handle error when multiple Storyboarder instances are open

repository.name: storyboarder
repository.description: Storyboarder makes it easy to visualize a story as fast you can draw stick figures.

issue.body:
Currently we get an http server error.

Two-part fix:

- [ ] Detect second instance of app and quit immediately. See: https://electron.atom.io/docs/all/#appmakesingleinstancecallback. Unfortunately this API is broken in 1.7.5 https://github.com/electron/electron/issues/9880 (UPDATE: Shouldn't be possible to open two instances in production, so this is not critical)

- [x] Notify user of error binding to port, in cases where there is only a single instance but the port is already bound on the system for some reason. 8b2ca87

- [x] Remove notification

issue.title: Investigate alternative to `makeSingleInstance`

repository.name: oni
repository.description: Oni: Modern Modal Editing - powered by Neovim

issue.body:
I was investigating the `makeSingleInstance` behavior, which looks like was regressed in Electron in 1.7.x+:  electron/electron#9880. This is very important for OSX to behave like other native apps - as calling 'oni' again in the terminal should focus the existing instance.

I was looking at atom's way of handling this:
https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/2f2d62ca51d91c4b8730bce0a0d0c1b12991704c/src/main-process/atom-application.coffee

It looks like they create a shared socket at a canonical path (looking at where `socketPath`) is used, and use that to detect when a new instance pops up...

Ideally, we could leverage the `makeSingleInstance` API, but it might be worth investigating alternatives.

issue.title: app.makeSingleInstance is wrong

repository.name: electron
repository.description: :electron: Build cross-platform desktop apps with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS

issue.body:
<!--
Thanks for opening an issue! A few things to keep in mind:

- The issue tracker is only for bugs and feature requests.
- Before reporting a bug, please try reproducing your issue against
  the latest version of Electron.
- If you need general advice, join our Slack: http://atom-slack.herokuapp.com
-->

* Electron version: 1.7.1
* Operating system: Mint 18

### Expected behavior
```javascript
const electron = require('electron');
const { app, Menu, Tray} = require('electron')
const ipc = electron.ipcMain;
let tray;
let mainWindow;
const iconFile = `${__dirname}/images/icon.png`;

const shouldQuit = app.makeSingleInstance(function(commandLine, workingDirectory) {
    // Someone tried to run a second instance, we should focus our window
    if (mainWindow) {
        mainWindow.show();
    }
    return true;
});
console.log(`shouldQuit: ${shouldQuit}`)
if (shouldQuit) {
    app.quit();
    return;
}
```
<!-- What do you think should happen? -->
I would like to keep the old process and kill the new one. Right now it kills the old and creates a new.
Only one. that's right, but I want to keep the old one.

Besides, ```shouldQuit``` is almost always false.

### Actual behavior
It works, but wrong. It doesnt keep the exsiting, it quits the old one and starts a new one. 

<!-- What actually happens? -->

### How to reproduce

<!-- 

Your best chance of getting this bug looked at quickly is to provide a REPOSITORY that can be cloned and run.

You can fork https://github.com/electron/electron-quick-start and include a link to the branch with your changes.

If you provide a URL, please list the commands required to clone/setup/run your repo e.g.

  $ git clone $YOUR_URL -b $BRANCH
  $ npm install
  $ npm start || electron .

-->

# Log
```text
atrikx3@workstation ~/Projects/patrikx3/onenote $ ./bin/p3x-onenote.js  &
[10] 24957
[9]   Done                    ./bin/p3x-onenote.js
patrikx3@workstation ~/Projects/patrikx3/onenote $ shouldQuit: false


patrikx3@workstation ~/Projects/patrikx3/onenote $ ./bin/p3x-onenote.js  &
[11] 25072
patrikx3@workstation ~/Projects/patrikx3/onenote $ shouldQuit: false


[10]-  Done                    ./bin/p3x-onenote.js
patrikx3@workstation ~/Projects/patrikx3/onenote $ 
patrikx3@workstation ~/Projects/patrikx3/onenote $ 
patrikx3@workstation ~/Projects/patrikx3/onenote $ 
patrikx3@workstation ~/Projects/patrikx3/onenote $
```
With 2, not working right.

# If i fire many, sometimes it works as expected

```text
patrikx3@workstation ~/Projects/patrikx3/onenote $ ./bin/p3x-onenote.js  &
[12] 25209
patrikx3@workstation ~/Projects/patrikx3/onenote $ ./bin/p3x-onenote.js  &
[13] 25232
patrikx3@workstation ~/Projects/patrikx3/onenote $ ./bin/p3x-onenote.js  &
[14] 25254
patrikx3@workstation ~/Projects/patrikx3/onenote $ 
patrikx3@workstation ~/Projects/patrikx3/onenote $ ./bin/p3x-onenote.js  &
[15] 25278
patrikx3@workstation ~/Projects/patrikx3/onenote $ ./bin/p3x-onenote.js  &
[16] 25298
patrikx3@workstation ~/Projects/patrikx3/onenote $ ./bin/p3x-onenote.js  &
[17] 25322
patrikx3@workstation ~/Projects/patrikx3/onenote $ 
patrikx3@workstation ~/Projects/patrikx3/onenote $ ./bin/p3x-onenote.js  &
[18] 25345
patrikx3@workstation ~/Projects/patrikx3/onenote $ shouldQuit: false

shouldQuit: true

shouldQuit: true

shouldQuit: false


[11]   Done                    ./bin/p3x-onenote.js
```

Fixes #9880
